DataElement.preferredName: Bone Dual X-ray Absorptometry Femur Bone Density Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates._A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured. (MedicineNet.com)_The longest and largest bone of the skeleton, it is situated between the hip and the knee._Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates._The amount of something per unit size._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.
The upper leg bone positioned between the pelvis and the knee.
The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
The amount of something per unit size.
